I had a question regarding the shipment and ElectonicsPlusInc emailed me and called me back resolving my question. They are very prompt and courteous. I would definatly order from them again. Thanks you - ***** - FIVE Stars.The Canon Power Shot is easy to use - Love it.  Much easier to understand and use then my old SONY camera.

Reviews.Title: Owned this for several years and it still works great! My favorite camera with video-like feature!
Reviews.Author: Maye
Reviews.Content: This is one of my best camera that I had owned out of 5-8 cameras that I had before. My second best was a pink Panasonic Lumix point-and-shoot camera (forgot the model #).  I researched it from Consumer Reports and it was listed as the runner-up.  So I bought it and I fell in love with it the first time I used it!  Love the video capability, which I was looking for.  To address most reviewers' problem of blurry pictures, yes I did got that, BUT I fixed it with manually adjusting the ISO and/or the shutter speed, turning the ISO to 800. And viola!  The blurriness was gone!  I think most standard camera is set to 200 or 400.  But if you want to take a photo of fast moving objects, you may want to adjust the ISO, although I don't remember if the number should go down or up.  Just need to experiment with it.The battery like is good, I can take photos several times or days before it runs out and I have this camera for years!I'm not a photographer but I like taking pictures, especially close-up pictures of objects and of food.  The quality of the pictures are very nice.  Not so sure in dim or night settings, though.  I also bought a Canon SLR beginner camera, but the Canon SD1200IS is so light, easy and simple to use, that I still use this instead of the SLR camera.I would definitely recommend buying this camera!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: Steven Byrd
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in December 2009. Since then I have taken well over 20,000 pictures and several hours of video. The PowerShot can take a beating and keep running smoothly. It's small enough that it won't burden you on long trips and the battery packs charge up quickly. The optical to digital zoom allows for fantastic quality pictures. Never once did I have any major problems with this camera. I gladly recommend it to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: Hits the spot
Reviews.Author: C. Counts "Turd Ferguson"
Reviews.Content: At the price point, this was a great purchase. The camera is durable, has good battery life, and takes nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: lost the first one,
Reviews.Author: isawuonmontel
Reviews.Content: I like this camera, as a semi-pro I never paid much attention to these cameras but when I go outdoors it has the advantage of actually being with me, a cell phone could not fill that gap because the quality is too poor, I did not expect much but was surprised at the quality of the pics, I use picasa 3 as a editor and it works well.  In low light the auto focus uses a lot of battery power and sometimes hunts,  day or night, not for action shots etc. overall I like this model and re bought it when someone else also liked it. at this point I would likely get a newer model in case I loose this one.

Reviews.Title: Looking for a new camera!
Reviews.Author: nervous
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera two years ago. Originally, I was pleased. However, I have to agree with many of the other reviewers. I am getting so many blurry photos, it's not worth keeping anymore. I have tried all the suggestions mentioned with no luck. Not sure what the problem is. Tonight was the final straw. I was at a school musical, took about 10 pictures, 8 were blurry. Took two shots with my video camera which was at a much lower resolution, and the pics were awesome!! I tried, I'm done!

Reviews.Title: Annoying
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: I loved the camera at first. Super cute, great zoom, and very sleek. Over time though, I realized it took forever to take a picture. If you didn't press the button "just so" you'd miss the shot. Image Stabilizer? Muh..I wasn't so impressed.

Reviews.Title: It finally joined the defective pile...
Reviews.Author: Left behind in TN
Reviews.Content: It worked OK for two years, that's the reason for the two stars... but it's DEAD now. They should put "DISPOSABLE" in the box, so it wouldn't hit you that hard when it stops working with no reason. I can't believe Canon is still getting away with this, shows you the power of corporate impunity, not just by putting a defective product on the shelf but not doing anything about it. Shameful...

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: AAM
Reviews.Content: The camera isn't awful, but I wouldn't recommend it being anyone's first choice.  The pictures don't focus very well sometimes and tend to create ghost-like images from surrounding lights.  Pictures aren't always terrible though.

Reviews.Title: Viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Francine Kammeyer
Reviews.Content: I looked at a number of small point-and-shoot cameras for one with a viewfinder, and this was the only one which met that need as well as taking good pictures for me.  The videos are good, too.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: A. Shattuck
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera as a gift for my wife as she wanted a camera with a viewfinder rather than using the LCD screen. Camera is simple to use and easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Canon Camera and it is WONDERFUL!  It takes nice pictures, pretty easy to use, and very easy to transport.  Just make sure you have a case for it so it doesn't crack or break!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Margaret A. Costin "Margaret"
Reviews.Content: This Canon PowerShot SD1200IS, 10 MP is the best little camera I've owned.Easy set up and intructions.  I had a Sony to learn on, but love this littlecamera - it takes great pictures..Love the Auto setting.  The best thing for me,the camera comes with a long life battery and charger, no more Double A batteries.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Bought it to give my mom for her birthday. She loved it and I was very satisfied by how easy it was to use. Turns on very fast (less than a second) and auto function allows my mom to take pictures without worrying about controls and features.

Reviews.Title: Great for True Amatures
Reviews.Author: pajamas_ak
Reviews.Content: For a point and shoot camera, I think this one is above and beyond. For someone who really loves photography but has no means for a "real" camera, this one is a great choice! I have captured some amazing shots and am extremely happy with the results I am able to obtain with this camera. It has a wide array of settings and affects that you can use, once you learn where they are. But these allow a versatility that is far wider than your average pocket camera.The only thing I have found which bothers me, is once you start shooting a video, the camera will not refocus if you zoom in or out from your initial setting.I would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for a point and shoot that offers fantastic quality. It's made me a Canon lover for life!

Reviews.Title: great!
Reviews.Author: jepetto
Reviews.Content: adore this camera. It's small, has many functions, easy to use. I only wish it would take pictures of movement better. Thx!

Reviews.Title: Gift for Sister
Reviews.Author: J. Ruvio "KayakSurfer"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my sister to use.  Coupled the gift with a 16gb SDHC card from Patriot.  Purchased in March of 2010.  Have used the camera a few times, when my sister comes over with her son and I'll take photos of the two of them.  Amazon always comes in as the better deal than what I can get locally.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Kara Boatman "KaraBoatmen"
Reviews.Content: I really love me camera, I absoutly adore the color, its nice and portable, its easy to use and doesn't bother me when im carrying it around on my travels. The only problems I have with it are that it takes a second to take the picture, so if you want really quick shots, this isn't the right camera. Also, I found that the price is a bit much, for what it really does, I know someone that got a really nice professial camera, for only 300 dollars. But other then that, I absoultly love it.

Reviews.Title: Works Great for Me for Over One Year
Reviews.Author: X. Xie
Reviews.Content: I've been using this for over a year.  Mainly use it on trips.  I chose it according to the ranking on Consumer Reports.  It is definitely the best value!  It makes it easy for me to take good-quality pictures except those with night mode (i tried it on a trip, and I friend had another brand which takes better night pictures than this one, but that doesn't hurt too much)  One feature I wanna praise it for is batter life.  I could charge it once, and use it for 2-3 days when I was on a trip and constantly taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: MV
Reviews.Content: Camera was just what I was looking for. Ease of use, great pic quality and offers video. Great camera and great deal

Reviews.Title: View Finder window!
Reviews.Author: trywait4
Reviews.Content: This is a fine compact camera. Selling point for me was that it had a view finder as well as the LCD display, as no compacts do anymore. Most of my pictures are in bright sun light rendering the LCD useless.The basic menu functions, with a little practice are simple as in to change focus range and flash on/off. My only recommendation is that Canon make the battery in unit charge abled, instead of having to remove the battery to charge it.

Reviews.Title: Very nice little camera!
Reviews.Author: umair g
Reviews.Content: I'll make this review short.This is a great camera for your parents, your sister, your girlfriend, or your less tech savvy bro.It's very portable, good quality, great price, and will last as long as taken care of. Canon is known for their quality in cameras and you can't go wrong with this one!If you want a more professional camera with higher resolution, better focusing, etc, then you know this isn't for you. This is a point and shoot camera.For anyone else this is a 10/10.For me (part time photographer) this is a 6/10 because I need and want more.Goto costco or buy from amazon. Cheap and gets the job done!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: adhouse
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera, Great pics but zoom isn't much at all. I wanted it simply to fit into my pocket and it's great for that. Mainly use it for one room picture taking like birthday parties.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD1200IS
Reviews.Author: V. Gentner "Rod Fan"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera and am delighted. I haven't found one flaw yet and doubt that I ever will.  The features are awsome, the picture quality superb and ease of use was just what I was looking for. I highly recommend this camera or any other camera that bears the name Canon PowerShot.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT!
Reviews.Author: Female "Danielle"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera almost a year ago and nothing has mal-functioned (yet). Great quality, great pictures, great close ups (I'll try and attach a few photos, but I haven't seen that option yet). Camera is light and I can take it anywhere. The different functions are great, Macro for extreme close-ups and Infinity for distance. The only down side is that it doesn't have color options like other cameras I've used and it takes poor night shots.Get one...you thank me later. ;)

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I decided it was time to upgrade my digital camera and bought this one based the reviews. It takes great pictures and is very easy to use. I really like the rechargeable battery...it will save me money since I won't have to buy AA batteries anymore. I am very happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera -- in the Canon Tradition
Reviews.Author: B. Tosto "btosto"
Reviews.Content: This is my second Canon camera. My first was a 4MP and delivered great photos at the time. It was top-rated then, and also recommended by a friend. There were some repair issues, but Canon took care of all of them at no cost to me, even those out of warranty. The new camera meets or exceeds my old one's performance -- at 10MP, it takes excellent photos, and with face recognition and the image stabilization feature, I rarely get a photo I can't use. I especially like the red eye fix removal feature/filter since my old Canon did not take care of this pesky problem well at all. Now, I rarely get the red eye problem. Good job, Canon. The placement of the memory card in the battery compartment is a little annoying, but certainly something I can live with. I bought an extra battery to switch out when the original one ran low. But, that hasn't happened yet. I appreciate the inclusion of a charger. Others I tried may have been better in terms of pixel depth, but it's a small sacrifice to go to 10MP when the camera comes with an essential charger. I would have liked to have a storage case for this product. But, it's only offered as an optional accessory. All-in-all, I'd say it was a best buy for me -- even if I wasn't crazy about the orange faceplate. But, it makes the camera easy to spot if you lay it down somewhere. Canon has done it again!

Reviews.Title: Everything good so far
Reviews.Author: M. Dragon
Reviews.Content: Everything has worked very well for us so far, the only annoyance is that the auto focus can flip out a bit when the camera is on and just pointed into space, as it keeps seeming to try to refocus.  Putting your hand near the lens or turning it off are both acceptable workarounds.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: D. Feng
Reviews.Content: I'm not very picky with my cameras. I've always had good experiences with Canon cameras, and this one seems pretty good so far. I went to [...] to compare cameras. A site like that is probably best to get a good technical review of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: Barbara Butterworth
Reviews.Content: I returned to Canon for an easy to use, portable camera, that takes great photos. Last year I was lured to another brand with a price promotion and was disappointed with the fuzzy, blurry photos it produced on a regular basis.  Canon is a great, affordable camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Book Lover
Reviews.Content: I got this to supplement my Canon S2 IS, for times when I don't want to lug a bulky camera around. This camera put the fun back in picture taking! I think the image stabilization is much better than in my other Canon and the colors seem more vivid. The only time the larger camera is definitely better is the 12X optical zoom vs this little guy's 3X zoom. I like this camera so well I am buying one for my son whose camera recently died. The only annoying issue is that I paid $169 at Amazon 2 weeks ago and now it is $179. That doesn't seem fair.

Reviews.Title: Love the Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Shaff
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It takes great snapshots.  It is great when I dont want to drag around my heavy Canon DSLR.  You can see the difference in the images, but this is a $200 camera and the DSLR was $1300 for the body so it is to be expected.Be careful of the Amazon "Package" deal.  I took advantage of it and the extra battery list is the wrong on for the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: hobby fan "pepperminttrain"
Reviews.Content: I've used a Canon 620 which has been a marvelous camera but I wanted something smaller and lighter. The 1200 is a wonderful little camera one third the weight of the 620 and takes equally good, sharp photos if not better. I bought a small case to wear on my belt and take the 1200 along wherever I go. Even the videos are sharp and the sound quite real.

Reviews.Title: Loving it.
Reviews.Author: L. M. Stinchcomb "Mimi in Georgia"
Reviews.Content: My old camera took too long to power up and way too long for recovery between shots.  This camera powers up immediately and I can take picture after picture quickly.  Loving it.

Reviews.Title: Novice Digital Camera User
Reviews.Author: J. Jones
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  I'm pretty loyal to my point and shoot cameras, but after losing some great shots because I ran out of film one vacation, I decided to check out digital cameras.  After reading the reviews on the Canon PowerShot, I decided to take the plunge and have not been disappointed.  It's small and easily fits inside my purse.  I'm still on a learning curve with all of it's features, but it's pretty cool.  The on-line manual is very helpful, but I wish it came in a booklet.  To find out about the different settings, you need to review the manual. Sometime when I have the inclination, I'll print it out.  So far I have found it easy to use and my pictures have turned out really nice.  I do have a tendency to move the camera when I take a picture so the stability control helps.  I've also used a suggestion from another user to set it to the Kids and Pets setting to help with subject movements. I have not had a problem with the buttons, but I do not have large hands.  I am looking forward to taking this camera on my next vacation where I'll have an opportunity to try out the beach and aquarium settings.  Along with the camera size and picture quality, I really like the fact that I can just set it on automatic or use the different settings.  It's just a great little camera for me.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this camera
Reviews.Author: Alan Manning "Gamairidium"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of all the functions and specially for the size of it. Slim and compact, you can take it everywhere. The battery lasts very long, even when you are taking video. I recommend to use a 4GB SD card or greater. SanDisk is always the best choice for SD cards. Also, the Canon Leather Compact Case PSC-55, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: Nice compact camera for the price.  The only thing I don't like is if you have it on it is constantly zooming in and out trying to focus.  Takes nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Nelson
Reviews.Content: I'm not much of a photographer but I read the reviews and decided to purchase this camera.  My last camera was a vivitar which did not last very long.  I received my camera recently and I simply love it.  I've not gotten a chance to check out all the features but for someone like me who knows little about photography this camera is easy to use, small and handy and I love the great green colour.  I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great camera if you want good shots with little thought!
Reviews.Author: Richard Kendall
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to England.  I took about 270 shots and can think of only two that came out poorly that I could blame on the camera itself. I was going to read the manual on the plane but that never happened, so I was taking shots based on figuring out the camera as I went, and it was really quite simple to operate. It took excellent shots indoors and outdoors in all kinds of conditions.  If you are interested in a camera that takes great shots without a lot of thought from you for vacations, family events, etc., this is a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: greaat buy
Reviews.Author: Mary Beatty "Grandma"
Reviews.Content: The product purchased was exactly what I ordered, expected and wanted.  It was delivered as promised and I would trade with this company again in a heartbeat.This is an excellent little camera for someone not brilliant at photography.  Simple to use, great picture quality and and easy to carry around.Mary Beatty

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Rowe
Reviews.Content: Camera is small, light, and easy to pack in your pocket. Its about the size of an average cell phone. The battery charges quickly and I like it much better than the AA that most other cameras take, it's much lighter and easier to install. It takes great pictures outside and works pretty good in Auto mode. Inside pictures are not as good as the outside pictures but most are still good. I have owned it for about one month. I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: A. Neiman
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this product. Only two minor complaints: the battery dies fast and I wish it came with a case.

Reviews.Title: great price on a great camera
Reviews.Author: B. Stapperfenne
Reviews.Content: My camera is great. I love it and it was in perfect condition and in a reasonable time.

Reviews.Title: excellent fun camera
Reviews.Author: Linda S. Noga "Linnie Sue"
Reviews.Content: I'll be the first to admit that my knowledge of a digital camera could fit into a thimble, this is my first purchase of a digital camera.  I bought it at my brother-in-law recommendation and I am extrememly happy with it.  It is small, takes nice clear shots, has an amazing zoom, adapts nicely to my PC.  There isn't a delay when taking the picture, and it tells you where it is focusing on the picture.  There is a small view if it is very sunny outside. It takes good shots during the day and at night.  I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Very happy so far
Reviews.Author: George Pillsbury "doughboy"
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and takes great pictures and by now I would have put batteries in twice in my old camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Jule Kijek
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after much research for my older daughter in North Carolina. I send it down so she could take pictures of my grand kids for me on Christmas day. She called and told me that she could only take pictures of them if she did not use the zoom feature. If she tried to zoom in even a little bit the pictures came out horribly  fuzzy. It was Christmas day and she could not return it as nothing was open. I have sent down the recipe so she can decide if she wants to get another of the same make/model or go with something else. Maybe we just got a lemon in that particular camera.

Reviews.Title: Check the lens
Reviews.Author: llo
Reviews.Content: I have been using the 1200 for about a month and could not understand why all my pictures looked mediocre.  Every camera setting did little to improve the quality.  We then notice there some sort of greasy film on the lens that appeared as if it could have been a finger print.  Cleaned the lens with lens tissue, now I have great pictures too.  Don't know how I could have done it so I wondered if I could have received it that way.

Reviews.Title: Poor latch on battery/SD Card Compartment
Reviews.Author: Dave Davis
Reviews.Content: I've owned Canons since the 70's.  I started out with an AE-1 and now have an XSi.  I'm very partial to Canon cameras and thought this one would be a good one to carry around in my pocket so I ordered one from Amazon.  I was really surprised when I received the camera and opened the battery compartment.  The battery compartment door and latch is plastic and very flimsy, didn't close with a tight "snap", and didn't seem strong enough.  I could just visualize the door breaking as I am constantly inserting and removing SD cards in my cameras.  I returned it without even snapping any photos so I really can't comment on photo quality. Knowing Canon, the quality is probably great but my concern over the latch was a major issue with me.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier!
Reviews.Author: alb304
Reviews.Content: This camera was wonderful! All I could hope! My worries are gone!I had a kodak easyshare for late 2008. Loved it at first but the camera had so many problems! The battery went out so much, and sometimes the camera would get glitchy and won't turn on.Then I got Nikon camera, this camera had HORRIBLE picture quality and video quality.Later I got a this cannon camera and couldn't be anymore pleased with it!I got it from amazon as a gift, the people who got it from me knew that I needed a camera and all my other cameras weren't going so good. I had it in blue, which this kind of blue is my favorite color. When I got it I tested it our. Charging the battery was a snap, I then started taking pictures.Buyer tip: This camera does not come with a memory card. If you want to actually use the camera and save pictures you need a memory card. I was lucky enough to use my old kodak memory card. (2 gb)For a lot of buyers I would reommend a 4 gb memory card, that should be more than enough memory if you don't plan on taking too many movies.I ran the software and all the stuff and got the pictures to the computer in a snap. The software the camera comes with is nice. You can do photostich, sort photos, make movies with clips and pictures and more!The camera has a nice design and is easy to use and haven't had any major problems. My biggest problem basically was it had no memory card. Which that shouldn't be a huge problem. you can get a memory card for a few bucks. The pictures are great and the movies were surprisingly good. The 10 megapixels certainly do help.

Reviews.Title: "The best camera is the one you have with you"
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Birge
Reviews.Content: This is, overall, a remarkable camera for the size and price. Wide aperture photography in reasonable lighting is where this excels, such as shooting portraits indoors or in shade. Unfortunately, the size of the camera means some very strict limitations in the conditions under which you can get good photos. The aperture at high f/# (i.e. when the aperture is stopped down to let less light in) is so small that you get noticeable diffractive blurring. Take a picture in landscape scene mode outside on a sunny day (which stops down the lens to increase depth of field), for example, and you'll notice a certain fuzziness to the picture due to the small aperture.Another problem area in the camera is in the auto mode. For reasons I still haven't figured out, while the camera seems to do a great job picking out the correct mode (i.e. portrait versus outdoor), the results in auto are almost never as good as if you just leave it in P (program) mode. For some reason auto mode usually results in overexposure and too high an ISO setting. This is especially true when using the flash. I'm guessing that the camera errs on the side of having too much light to work with, rather than underexposing, but the results are frustratingly poor compared to what you get with P most of the time.Despite the photo quality limitations, many of which are unavoidable on a camera of this size, this is a very nice camera. As they say, the best camera is the one you have with you, and the compact stature of this camera means that more often than not, this will be the best camera. You'll almost always get good shots, and sometimes you'll get great ones, just using the auto mode. If you know what you're doing, you can get surprisingly good results from this camera. In summary, while one should be aware that sacrifices have to made in the optics with a camera this small, this is about as good a camera as you can get at this size. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: GRINDING NOISE NEW, EVEN AFTER 2 ATTEMPTS
Reviews.Author: Toni Bautista "Tonis"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera new, bc of the reviews. I'm still not wanting to spend $400 on a good camera, so thought this would be a better option. SAVE YOURSELF TIME and MONEY. I returned the new camera, thinking that it was just my luck to get a camera that was beat up in the handling. Then I purchased it again, new, but I still had that problem. The camera was making noises even when I wasn't pressing a button. I think these reviews are from when the first batch of this model came out, bc I don't see how it can have such great reviews now in 2012. I got this because my sister-in-law's camera takes great pictures and I wanted to get the same camera. Since I dropped my camera, I have been using her camera and it does take great pictures ONLY if it's not dark and no movement in the AUTO setting. I remember it taking better pictures when it was newer. So now I'm glad I did return this camera. It's really sad that I can't find a good camera that is 10 mp, bc I don't want to go much higher in mp when I don't have that much space in my computer to save such big picture files.

Reviews.Title: Last of a dieing breed
Reviews.Author: Jeff Scott Olson
Reviews.Content: This is not just the last Canon pocketable point-and-shoot digital camera with an optical viewfinder; as far as I can tell it is the last such model of any brand available for anything near the price.  I have one I love and bought this one as a back-up for when it bites the dust.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Nathan Freier
Reviews.Content: This is a good point and shoot for anyone who just needs a camera for day to day use.  I just took it on my vacation and it seemed like we could not take a blurry picture.  There are a basic set of options for taking pictures but nothing overly done that you will find with a professional camera.  The speed between pictures is not long and can still take good pictures with fast speed.  The battery life was really good too, we only charged the battery once the entire week.  I personally liked the size of the camera, I was looking at the SD1400 before I looked at this camera and it was really small, so small that it affected my use of that camera.  The buttons on the SD1200 are big enough for my fingers and feels right in my hand.  Overall, I think it is a good point and shoot camera that gets the job done well.

Reviews.Title: Compared to A570IS, terrible
Reviews.Author: seller3578
Reviews.Content: I like the size and love the battery life.  Images suck.  I couldn't figure out what was wrong, but after using this form months, I realized, it simply was not nearly as good as my A570.  White balance always off, image clarity/sharpness, etc.  I'm not using it anymore and feel ripped off.  It's a good camera, but just not an improvement at all beyond the A-series.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: James. "Somewhere, Racin' or Playin' Music"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement to my previous 570IS, though I had a Nikon for a few days, but thats another story.This particular camera works just fine for your average run of the mill taking of pictures, It only has 3x optical zoom, so you can't get those close ups unless you're close up. it has a tough time with low light pictures at times, but its only a pocket rocket.Video, I use it too much, it has an audio limit, so no rock concerts unless you want all the breaking up and distortion of sound. I wish it had an image stabilization in the video like the Nikons, but it works fine.All in all, its ok, if you can get a killer deal like me.

Reviews.Title: Solid Digital Elph camera, feather light and great for hiking
Reviews.Author: Robert Neale
Reviews.Content: Great little camera for taking along on climbing or hiking trips. Weighs nothing and I can just keep it in a little pouch attached to my shoulder strap for easy access with one hand.Battery life is very good, optical zoom works smoothly and pictures are stable without a tripod. Still getting used to not having direct control over things like focus, but just have to get used to how it thinks and use the manual controls to make it do what I want. (my first non-SLR)Picture resolution is quite good, fast control over flash with it's dedicated button is really handy when you're in a hurry and need to ensure you don't get a flash when you don't want one.I purchased mine as a refurbished model from GRL Recovery. If you already have the misc parts (battery-charger etc) that come with the camera body, it is a great way to save some cash.The initial shipment of my camera was a problem as there were features that were broken when I turned on the camera. I sent the camera back and explained everything, and GLR Recovery was very responsive. Their supplier that does their refurbish work sent them a bad batch evidently. I had a pressing need for the camera with an upcoming family event, and they would have had difficulty getting me a replacement in time. So they simply sent me a brand new (not refurbished) camera of the same model and for my trouble refunded the full price I payed for the refurbished camera. The new camera came just in time and of course worked flawlessly and my family event was well covered. I was provided with excellent customer service and would purchase from them again.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Blurry Photos
Reviews.Author: briguy2012
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Canon PowerShot over the years, so when I left my SD1100 out in the rain, I didn't think twice about purchasing another Canon.  I liked the orange color of the SD1200, but it turns out that's the only thing I like about the camera.  The problem is that nearly every photo comes out blurry.  I've changed the settings, I've tried half-pressing the button to focus, but to no avail.  Sometimes it will take almost-acceptable shots, but any normal panorama shot comes out unusable.  If I zoom in, the quality become better.  But you shouldn't have to zoom in on everything just to take a decent photo, right?  I would return it, but I bought it just before moving overseas and I lost the box.  I'm going to have to end up just throwing it away and purchasing a new camera-  I have trips to Italy and Russia in the next few weeks and don't have the time to deal with Canon customer service.  I feel rather betrayed by Canon, that they would sell such a terrible camera-  this is probably the last Canon I will purchase.  Please do yourself a favor, and buy ANY other camera but this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera. Buy it without hesitation
Reviews.Author: Vijay
Reviews.Content: Just buy it. This is just great camera. I have reserached many and bought this. Didnt regret it.

Reviews.Title: Lens error
Reviews.Author: YP
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera exactly 13 month ago. Never had a problem and liked it overall. Easy to use, good picture quality and battery life was very good. Today however without any warning the lens doesn't open up and I get the error "lens error restart camera". 1 month past the warranty. Reading up on it I guess it is a known error that Canon doesn't warrant. I guess I will not buy a Canon anymore.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Camera!
Reviews.Author: Cookster "Jazz lover"
Reviews.Content: This is my third and last Canon, and I must say that as good as it is, it feels flimsier than the prior two.  The photos are great, which is really what counts.  There's no instruction booklet with it which another negative.  It just infuriates me the way companies make us work for every bit of information we need on these products anymore.  Is it really that hard to include the instructions?  Also, I ordered a 4GB San Disk, so Amazon (I guess) took out the original San Disk, replaced with this 4GB one, but I didn't get the original.  What's that all about?

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: guy smiley
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. Small enough to fit in a front pocket, can take fast photos, and the quality is pretty darn good. If you expect professional images this might not be for you. I bought this camera because I wanted a portable digital camera that was fast enough to capture my high-octane daughter, and durable to take on camping trips. You have to hold the shutter button half way down, but doing so takes pictures with almost no delay under most situations. Between the optical and digital zooms, you can get some impressive images from afar. I gave this camera 5 stars because the convention for rating products seems to be 5-stars minus any major flaws. This camera isn't perfect, but it has exeeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Hate this camera
Reviews.Author: Amanda Passmore
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to "upgrade" from an older digital camera when my daughter was born a year ago.  Like 80% of the pictures are blurry I've tried a bunch of settings and I've let other people try to fix it and it's always still blurry.  So I have missed out on so many good pictures cause it's hard to get a baby to stay still for photos.  I am very disappointed that the reviews led me wrong on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mar Pigao "mardom"
Reviews.Content: Love it!Very easy to use and my friends and family love it too! They love its slim design.

Reviews.Title: Great: But early to tell
Reviews.Author: Socks
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived quickly but does not come with a memory card so we couldn't us it until we figured out which memory card we needed...this was another $30.  Camera seems to work fine although we haven't used it enough to judge the battery life.  Overall, quite happy with the camera and it came highly recommended from a friend so we expect to enjoy it as much as she has...

Reviews.Title: Too bad... A great little camera that takes awful pictures.
Reviews.Author: teachergirl
Reviews.Content: How disappointing!  I currently own a Canon Powershot sd800is and I love it.  Perfect pics & videos, excellent battery life, durable, no issues whatsoever.  When my daughter saved her money up for a digital camera I really didn't look much farther than Canon because I wanted her to have a great camera.  Since the sd800is is no longer available we picked the updated version, the sd1200is, which has more mega-pixels and zoom than my old one.When it arrived, we charged the battery and began taking indoor pictures.  They were very blurry and they had a yellowish-orange glow.  (We even had one that showed a blue & green orb floating by my staircase. STRANGE!)  I tried adjusting the settings to fix the issues, but nothing worked.  I'm not a camera expert, but I understand what most of the features and menu itmes do.  I have used them on my sd800is with much success.  I had my husband and his brother (both are smart techy guys) work with the camera.  Still, we could not get it to take clear pictures.  When I tried to take pics outside they came out virtually white, completely overexposed. My daughter tried taking some pics and did have success, but only if she took them in pitch darkness with the flash on.  They were clear and sharp with good color.  They looked like they had been taken with my old camera.  But, how practical is a camera that only works in the dark???I called Canon support and they took me through the same steps I had already tried, finally suggesting that I ship it in for service.  They were very friendly, helpful, and professional, but they couldn't replace the product, only service mine and return it to me in about 3 weeks.After considering my 30 day return window with Amazon, I decided by the time I would get it back from Canon, if I wasn't satisfied, I wouldn't be able to return it.  So I declined the Canon service and simply returned it to Amazon, which was also a very simple and painless process.We ended up spending less than half as much on a Polaroid t1031.  It doesn't have all the cool features the Canon has (no video either), but it does have image stabilization, a rechargeable battery, and the greatest part... it takes good pictures!  And she has some money left in her pocket so that's a good thing as well.I won't say, "Don't buy a Canon" because I love my old one and the features and customer service are great.  I will say, "Don't be afraid to return it."  Most of the reviews are great, but sometimes you get a lemon like I did.  I chose not to make lemonade, I sent it back and got some pretty delicious orange soda.  YUM!!!

Reviews.Title: Good Beginner Camera, light on quality construction.
Reviews.Author: J. Turner
Reviews.Content: Good startup camera for point and shoot. There is a real difference in the quality of the construction between this and other Canon products I've owned. Slow focus. Good picture quality. Features are very helpful giving options to "auto mode" I think I would go up a model or two next time.

Reviews.Title: Everything's great except the speed of storing picture and moving on to the next
Reviews.Author: sandy
Reviews.Content: Except the fact that it takes sometime after taking one picture to move on to the next ready state, everything's satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Slow Shutter Speed
Reviews.Author: stracciatellamama
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera that takes great photos and is perfect for almost every occasion. My only issue with it is that the shutter has a delay, so sometimes you miss the picture you want and end up getting the second right after it.

Reviews.Title: Workinf great
Reviews.Author: Tung LE
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year ago,and it's still working great now.Maybe the short battery life isthe only con with this camera, I think.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Ganesh
Reviews.Content: The clarity is good.  Good LCD Display.  Good battery life.  I totally like it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Janette Fernandez
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after I lost my previous canon. The only thing I miss from my old canon is the color accent feature.  However, this camera takes beautiful pictures!

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot SD12001S
Reviews.Author: haljean1 "jean"
Reviews.Content: The camera came on time in good shape.  The only problem was that it did not ship with a battery. This was not mentioned, that I saw, before purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: CoCo E.
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and is very easy to use.  Battery life is great...just went to Egypt and was able to take 3 days worth of pictures before having to charge the battery...and the battery wasn't even dead at that point.One thing I wish this camera had that other Cannon's have is the Vivid Color feature.  I love the effect of making the whole picture black and white and just having one color stand out.Otherwise, I have no complaints and I LOVE the green color!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Emily L. Cubitt "nurse mom"
Reviews.Content: Had last year's model of same camera but was unfortunately lost.  Chose to get same camera since the previous one was such a good product.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Ivery "Amazon Junkie"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  I've only owned two digital cameras and this one is the best so far.  The picture quality and features are great.  It's fits easily in my purse, with a case.  I was looking for a pink camera only, and this one is not only cute, it gets the job done.  I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: A smaller replacement with bigger results
Reviews.Author: T. Jones
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera to replace a larger Fuji.  I wanted more portability, but worried that I would miss the more powerful zoom of my older camera (6 yrs old).  We took this on a trip to the zoo and could not be happier.  It will definately satisfy those who are back in the market for a good, easy to use camera.  I'm a point-and-shoot, "leave it on automatic" sort of girl.  I left a photo that we took with this camera in the customer images section (it's a bird being fed birdseed in the zoo)...check it out, this camera is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: Andrea7322
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the $$. I bought it to replace my Kodak Easy Share, which decided to break the week after my son was born.  My only complaint is the battery life, however, it lasts as long as was indicated in the product description.

Reviews.Title: great purchase
Reviews.Author: S. Naone "family first"
Reviews.Content: My 10-year-old daughter bought this with her money when her twin sister got it as a Christmas present.  It is easy for them to operate so they have taken many beautifulpictures.  No missed opportunities for pictures as the battery life is very reliable.  A great camera for ages 9 to 99!

Reviews.Title: Excellent smal camera
Reviews.Author: Nathan Silberman "SNathan"
Reviews.Content: Easy to carryEasy to useExcellent picture quality under normal conditions. I did not try it yet under extreme conditions.Lots of setting through menus that allow obtain different  effects (lighting, white balance, etc.)Good return for the price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: B. E. Bradley
Reviews.Content: I finally broke down and replaced my old Canon 2.1 mega pixel camera. I debated over several cameras and chose the Canon SD1200 IS for it's size, features, other reviews and the reliability of my old Canon camera. I love it. Some reviewers complained about blurry pictures and I had a couple of them myself at first but if you read and follow the instructions this probably won't be an issue. I don't think I could have done better for $149.00.

Reviews.Title: Another nice Canon powershot
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Krall
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife and she loves it!  I've been buying Canon products for years and always find them to be well designed and easy to use, with very good picture quality.  Like most other Powershot cameras, this model works well in automatic mode but also has enough controls to get good shots in tricky situations.  Many other cameras won't even allow you to shut off the flash.

Reviews.Title: Canon sd1200
Reviews.Author: Dennis L. Bayer
Reviews.Content: Just got it about 10 days ago and so far it is really nice. I wanted something small to use for cycling.  I'm still getting used to it, but I'm getting some very nice photos for a camera this tiny. I dhot pix of some items I'm selling on EBAY and they are super sharp.

Reviews.Title: Big camera in a little package
Reviews.Author: C. Clementi
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter.  I have 2 Canon digital cameras of my own so I know they are great products.  It is so easy to use and has lots of features although not so many that you can't figure out what to do.  It feels sturdy when you are holding it and it's small enough to fit into a pocket.  The picture quality is amazing and it has really good battery life. It comes in fun colors too. I think you can't go wrong if you are looking for a simple to use, everyday camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for price, size and pics are excellent!!!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Callender
Reviews.Content: In my line of work, most of the times I'm on the field and taking snap shots to built visual data to assist in my reports and this lil wonder totally got the job done!!! I must say my coworkers are in love with its ability and quality shots it produces, also thinking of purchasing one for themselves.  Not only it fits into my professional life, but also my social life...my island just celebrate the "Greatest Show on Earth"  which is Trinidad Carnival and the shots are amazing!!!!!! Go for it great buy!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera in a compact size
Reviews.Author: Michelle Connor
Reviews.Content: I decided to get this camera when the sony I have had for almost 4 years quit uploading to my computer, and erasing pictures on its own.  I researched it on consumer reports and it was the 3rd ranked camera in it's class, and the 2 that beat it were $300 cameras!  I love the color, it says "red" but of course it's more hot pink, which I love.  I love that it also comes in other colors as well.  It takes excellent pictures, when I first got it I took a picture of my cat in very low light and with the red eye reducer on, even my cat didn't have red eye.  I have yet to take a blurry picture, the auto focus is fast, and so is being able to take many pictures in a row.  It's fast also with the flash on and the red eye light, at least faster than other camera's I have personally used recently (my sony and my parent's nikon slr)  I love that it has a rechargeable battery, so I don't have to constantly carry around AA batteries, I did buy an extra battery to keep as a spare in care I'm out somewhere like the zoo or something. Canon PowerShot SD1200IS 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Pink/Red) I would recommend this most definitely.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew Pungprakearti
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my fiancee for Christmas. The camera we had been using before this one was a 2002ish Sony Cybershot. This camera is so much better in every aspect. The camera is super easy to use even for non-techy types. The LCD screen is huge and very clear. The only things I don't like about the camera: I had to buy a memory card for it(The camera didn't come with one), and I have to physically remove the battery every time I want to charge the camera. In my old Sony camera I was able to just plug a cord into the camera to charge it. Overall though, it is a great camera and my fiancee and I are both very satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Lolly
Reviews.Content: This is a nice affordable, simple point and shoot digital!  The camera does "chatter" a bit while focusing, but as long as you are not taking pictures in a library there is usually enough outside noise that you hardly notice.Battery life is great, I just took it to Iceland for a week and the battery lasted the whole time.  I took about 300 pictures and 4 videos on one complete charge!Picture quality is decent for a point and shoot.  Shots during the daytime/bright light are best but if you have a steady hand you can manage OK pictures in low light as well.  The screen is great, nice and clear, but if your batteries are running low you can still use the view finder to  eeke out more pics (which I have done on vacations).Overall, Canon put out a nice, simple product for the average Joe Photographer.  It's a good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Scheibel "Shutterbug"
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price.  Large screen, great picture quality, and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Canon power shot digitial Camera
Reviews.Author: Shannon M. Rueb
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my sister for Christmas! She loves it! it was easy to set up and we took pictures that very day, just make sure you get a memory card to go with it! We love making videos and taking lots of photos. Good Camera for her first one!!

Reviews.Title: a good camera
Reviews.Author: Bing Chen
Reviews.Content: it a good camera for me, i think it is easy to use it and the picture looks nice

Reviews.Title: Canon SD1200IS
Reviews.Author: Henry S. Majsterek
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything I expected and more.  The pictures are great and the quality is awesome.  I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: great small camera\
Reviews.Author: Leslie A. Pattullo
Reviews.Content: This travels well and takes the best pictures of my grandsons.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: Was surprised
Reviews.Author: SJ
Reviews.Content: My wife needed a point and click camera after looking at few reviews bought it. Its been a real delight , the pictures are crisp and its very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my wife
Reviews.Author: Darren Mack
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a Christmas present for my wife.  She was looking for something small and portable that she could fit into her purse and keep with her at all times. This fits the bill perfectly.  It's easy to use, takes good pictures (for what it is), and the battery has great life.  Best of all - since she got it in pink, it stands out from everyone else's when in a crowd.

Reviews.Title: love it overall
Reviews.Author: R. Kern
Reviews.Content: I really love the camera..took me a little bit to figure it out but would of helped if I read the instructions first.great size easy to take with to use when ever I want without planning it.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: R. Smith
Reviews.Content: got this for my husband and we both love it!  great pics and very portable!  love the options it has for picture taking also!

Reviews.Title: Money = quality
Reviews.Author: Dorothea Jordan
Reviews.Content: The only feature that would make this camera perfect would be a more powerful zoom.

Reviews.Title: excellent little camera for everyday use
Reviews.Author: Patricia Olofson
Reviews.Content: Canon powershot cameras are great for novices like myself.  Easy to use, easy to wownload the pictures.  There limitations especially if you try to use the flash too far away or at night but that goes with territory of a little point and shoot.  Great for taking spur of the moment shots.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera!
Reviews.Author: Caroline "clsmarathon"
Reviews.Content: This camera has a great bang for the buck.  It takes great pictures, and the automatic stabilization is a lifesaver.  It also takes some decent quality video, too.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Pictures
Reviews.Author: C. Genova
Reviews.Content: I recently bought the Powershot SD1200 after I lost my SD1100 which I loved.  I also own a Canon Rebel SLR, so I've always been very happy with my Canons.  I am unhappy with the quality of the pictures even when they do come out clear...I've never had a camera that took such blurry pictures! I'm not sure if it's my individual camera that has an issue, or if anyone else has experienced similar problems. I'm thinking of giving this away and buying the SD780 IS- which I've heard good things about.

Reviews.Title: Pretty in Pink
Reviews.Author: H. Lee
Reviews.Content: The color is really the clincher.  Although the camera itself is great in its portability and function, the vibrant pink just makes you want to carry it around and take pictures.  It's great!

Reviews.Title: loved it!!!
Reviews.Author: S. Rejano
Reviews.Content: I will recommend this product to everyone I know. It is user's friendly, the picture quality is so good even at night time. And trust Amazon for handling my products from the day I order to the day they delivers. They handle it very well and very punctual.Thanks for the job well done.

Reviews.Title: very good little camera
Reviews.Author: I. M. Poster
Reviews.Content: Good quality, has many "specialty" modes; but Canon left out the color enhancement feature that was present on its previous models.

Reviews.Title: Even my Husband can use it!
Reviews.Author: Kim Bishop O'Steen "K. O'Steen"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Husband for Christmas.  The simple fact that it's now February and he hasn't run over it with his truck, means he loves it!Simple to use and has a great battery system.  We own two!  No more carrying pockets full of batteries to Orchid Shows!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful  ++
Reviews.Author: S. Miller "Stillwater Traveler"
Reviews.Content: A truly great camera.  Very high quality pictures even in low light without flash.  Easy to use.  Long battery life ( several days and taking over 100 pictures per 15 hour day )  Easy manual off and on.  Recommend this camera to every tourist.  Shirt pocket size.  Light weight.  I did not expect any camera to be this good.  Has plenty of functions for the camera geek but I/we tend to do everything on auto and all pictures per great except for those taken from a fast moving train in modest light.  I was surprised these pictures were even "seeable".

Reviews.Title: Nice piece of equiptment
Reviews.Author: John I. Stoeppel "Author of the novel, Driven."
Reviews.Content: For as little as I paid for this camera it takes nice pictures. I have been disappointed with many other digital camera's in the past and never thought I would find one I like. canon did a wonderful job with this camera for it is easy to use and understand. I have taken pictures with this camera using some of the features in the easy to navigate menu and when I have printed them out and showed friends and collages they were impressed with the quality. Bravo to canon for this product. I use it more then I thought I would.

Reviews.Title: Great convenient camera
Reviews.Author: Dawn Jacoby "AuroraD"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I can't get all techie like some other reviews, but I can tell you that I travel quite a bit and this is an ideal pocket camera. I'm VERY happy with the quality of the pics and the ease of use. It was easy to start out and easy to figure out all of the features. I waited a long time to upgrade from my old Canon (2 megapixils! It's been that long!) and I'm happy with this choice. My only quibble is that it doesn't have a panoramic feature (unless it's hidden in there somewhere and I haven't found it yet...). The size is very good and fits quite nicely in my hand. It's made of METAL and not plastic and you can't go wrong with Canon lense standards. I also like that it runs on a rechargeable battery pac and comes with a charger. All one needs is another backup battery and switch out when the first is charging. No more carrying a bunch of AA batteries on a trip or paying inflated prices on vacation.

Reviews.Title: Great little digital camera
Reviews.Author: M. Stevens-Becksvoort "challenged1"
Reviews.Content: I use these with middle school students - the cameras are surprisingly sturdy and have held up through much use and some abuse. We have a number of Canon digital camera products with which we are very satisfied. I try to buy cameras that will have interchangeable batteries - these can go several weeks between charging depending on how careful the students are. All of our cameras are in use daily by multiple students. They are easy to learn to use and there are enough manual features that the users have latitude for imaginative use.Overall, if what you want is a small, easy to manipulate camera, that will stand up to a lot of use, then this might be the one for you.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Lang
Reviews.Content: This camera has the attributes that I wanted: great picture quality, easy use and can fit into my pocket.  It is so easy to use and so portable that I find myself taking more pictures.  It's performed well for me even in very cold temps; I took it cross country skiing and was able to operate it with light gloves on.  And the cold (perhaps 20 degrees) did not affect performance.  The software that comes with it has some minor editing features that are very handy when you want to make so quick changes so that you can email pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Y. LEE
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon Power Shot SD1200IS camera during Thanksgiving time.  Based on so many good reviews and right price ($149).  I decide to order it.  Wait for a little bit longer to get it because the color I picked was in back order.I specially like the continuous shot function.  It take me sometime to figure it out (need to push the shot bottom all the time during shots).  I ususlly don't read manual and like to figure it out myself.  Anyway, it is an excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: canon elph 1200
Reviews.Author: slccgolfer
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my wife as a Christmas present.  We have a Rebel XTI but that is too bulky for her everyday use.  Wanted something to take quick pix of grandkids.  Camera is perfect for this.  Good quality, easy to use and reasonably quick.  For what I paid, I believe the value is good.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Suzy "game gal"
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect camera for me.  It is small and fits in my purse.  The picture quality is significantly better than our older digital camera.  Each picture has the date.  I am far from a professional photographer, but it is easy to use and easy to upload on to my laptop. Oh, yes, I am 67 and I gave one to my 14 year old granddaughter.  We both love the fun colors that are available.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Rothenberger
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use and takes great pictures!  It is also very compact and easy to take along.

Reviews.Title: This camera is great!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Brentlinger
Reviews.Content: This is the best compact digital camera that I have ever purchased.  The picture quality is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Canon SD1200IS
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Grabske
Reviews.Content: It is a good camera but not a great one.  Mainly it is very convenient to carry and use.  It also shares many of the conttrol features of my SX10IS, so did not need to learn a lot of new tricks to make it work.  Image quality is fine for 4 by 6 prints but not nearly up to the quality of the pictures from my SX10. Did not expect that, so am quite happy with this very small and convenient camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera , great price
Reviews.Author: TN Rupp
Reviews.Content: This camera was for my wife and she wanted something small and easy to use. she loves it!!!! and the quality of the product is great! would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: Love my Cannon!
Reviews.Author: R. Almquist
Reviews.Content: Great camera!! I am a novice user and didn't want to invest in the $800 options out there. I was looking for a relatively inexpensive camera to stick in my bag that took good pictures - I found what I was looking for! It is fairly fast in good lighting; the flash slows it down for only a millisecond. I have no regrets about purchasing this camera and have not had any issues with picture quality, video quality or the battery. It is lightweight and versatile. You can't go wrong if you are looking for a good camera under $150.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Low Light Photos
Reviews.Author: TCarroll
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this camera as a gift to myself to replace a Canon Powershot S2iS. Not that it wasnt a great camera, but it was just too big for me to be able to conveniently take it with me, so I missed alot of photo ops.The SD1200is the perfect size to stick in your pocket or in your purse, and I just tend to leave it in my purse so I'll always have it in case the need arises. Much better photos than those from my camera phone!The main thing about this camera though..at least for me...is the fantastic pictures that it takes in very low light. It was put to the test recently when we were at the hospital for the birth of a grandchild. The only light that was on was some ambient lighting around the ceiling and my pictures were as clear and perfect as they would have been taken outside on a sunny day. AND...it wasnt even using the flash! I would take one and someone would say " It didnt flash" thinking no doubt they were catching a "user error" LOL!  But the picture was perfect, which I made sure to show them! Im sure I converted several people that day and they will be getting one of these cameras too.Another low light situation is when I take photos for online selling. Before the SD1200is, I would be going all over the house trying to find just the right light that wouldnt cast shadows, that would show the true colors, etc etc. Now it doesnt matter where I take the shot...the picture is great...even on the macro setting!The battery life is decent...I charged it the first time the early part of December and the low battery signal didnt appear until the middle of January. That's after probably over 100 photos were taken.I highly recommend this camera to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Common problem strikes again
Reviews.Author: hberrybug
Reviews.Content: This camera was rated great by Consumer Reports and various other sources, and so far it is all its been hyped to be.  For the price it is extremely light, easy to use and the pictures are of very good quality.3 years later and with very light use I report that both cameras I purchased (same model one for my daughter one for me) have the same issue.  A year ago my daughters lens got stuck in the out position and two weeks ago same for me.  No reason, it happened in the middle of snapping a picture at my neice's wedding.  Got a "lens error, restart error" which I Googled and got a barrage of sites with this same issue and complaints about Canon service.  Not worth the price to fix.  Off to research non-Canon options for a replacement

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot 10MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: M. E. Kob
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my husband to take on deployment.It was super simple to use & takes great pics! The battery lifeis really good & the compact size will be perfect for him to storeon the limited ship space. I love that it comes with a charger sohe doesn't have to worry about buying batteries.Loved it so much I went ahead & bought one for myself! Will be morethan happy to give up my older junky Kodak for this one!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Angela Mcjunkins
Reviews.Content: It was just what I wanted.  It was an perfect size and took great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Another Great Value from Canon
Reviews.Author: Cunning Consumer
Reviews.Content: Bought as Christmas present for my wife.  She loves it. Takes great photos and is fairly easy to learn to use.  The HOT PINK color is wild. Only suggested improvements: (1) include paper user manual with camera(Internet download version is too lengthy to print); (2)include an SD card with the camera so it can be used out of the box.  This would be worth a few dollars more on the price if necessary.

Reviews.Title: The perfect camera
Reviews.Author: J. Strauch "The Doctor"
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot SD1200 IS replaced our last camera, the Nikon CoolPix 4600, which was possibly the worst camera I ever purchased. I researched the Canon PowerShot SD1200 extensively, and was able to find a couple of friends who already had it to confirm that it was as good as the ads said, and it was.Ese of use, fast first picture taking, and fast repeat picture taking as well.The biggest problem we had with the Nikon was that it eat baterries in as little as 50 pictures, and we tried buying expensive batteries specifically made for digital camera, including the newest lithium batteries, but it still keep asking for new batteries.I recommend the Canon PowerShot SD1200 IS to anybody looking for a great camera.Good job Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Petko A. Zlatev "pazdenver"
Reviews.Content: This is an upgrade camera from a canon 400 series.  Controls are easy to operate, and generally understandable.  Still unable to figure out how to change the picture resolution, but have not played with it that long.  Picture-taking is fast - primarily operated by an 8 year old, and the pictures come out clear under normal light conditions.I would purchase this again - I have had very good luck with canon products

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Tomas Costa M. Mello
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, easy to use and take very good pictures, it's not a pro camera but to use in vacations and things like this you not need anything more

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: A. Schultz
Reviews.Content: We received this camera just before Christmas.  It takes high quality pictures and is easy to transfer the pictures to my computer.  I like that you can just press one button to go back and forth between viewing the pictures and taking pictures.  It was nice that we received a free memory card from Amazon since one does not come with the camera.  The size is perfect, I can slip it into my pocket.  We have only had it 3 weeks but I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great buy for college students
Reviews.Author: L. Allen
Reviews.Content: This is really popular among my friends in college right now. We're all about 21, trying to capture our end of 4-5 years of fun, and this camera is convenient and fun. I bought one online just like my friend did and am totally happy with the quality and ease of use. I am not technologically savvy by a long shot.

Reviews.Title: Christmas
Reviews.Author: Laura Gibson
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 18 year old daughter.  She wanted this more than anything on her list.  She loves it.  She uses it for all of her Facebook pictures for her and friends.  Probably better cameras out there but it does the job for her.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, lotsa features, not a lot of fuss!
Reviews.Author: R. Aaron "RosaFay"
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an inexpensive camera with a lot of features but that's also easy to use -- this is it!  I needed a camera that's easy to use [just to can grab shots or video of the kids while we're on the fly] and this camera does a great job.  From set up to picture download, the process is painless.  The quality of the pictures, even when you leave everything set to 'auto', is good enough for sharing pictures with family and friends, or on FB.

Reviews.Title: PowerShot 1200IS Review
Reviews.Author: Anthony A. Barbieri
Reviews.Content: Absolutely superb picture quality!  This is a great camera, in all regards, except for the following "chinks in the armor:"  -  Repeat shots are "okay," but I'd prefer to have them quicker  -  Image downloads require yet another application ... not hard to do, but it could be easier.Overall ... this is a great camera, worth every penny ... and more!Tony B

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: David V.
Reviews.Content: I bought the SD1200IS a few weeks ago for my (very young) daughter, who wanted a "real" camera.I was surprised at how much camera she got for a hundred and fifty bucks.  (The last camera I bought close to this class was a SD800 three or four years ago, and it cost three times that back then; it's only a slightly better camera.) The build is excellent and pleasing to the eye (she got the blue version; close to a shade of turquoise). Image quality is decent for this small of a camera (my daughter only makes 4"x6" prints on a Selphy 770, and for that the image quality is ample). I wish though that Canon had the guts to make this a 4 megapixel camera or so: Making it 10 megapixels worsens things. The user interface is actually better than the SD800 I have: I like the separate "review" button, and the three way slider to select between "full automatic", "manual" (really, "just 95% automatic"), and "movie" also makes the camera more accessible (as required for my child).So, overall, we are very pleased so far.

Reviews.Title: Versatile
Reviews.Author: gabazero
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Very good in low light, Handy, Versatility, Great Resolution, Large Clear LCD, Nice Features and Settings, Can zoom optically when recording video, Good Battery Life, Dynamic Range, Optical View Finder, Tops on Consumer Reports subcompact camera ratingsCons: Complicated Controls, First shot delay, Some image noise, No Panoramic modeBest Uses: Everyday Photos, Home, Travel

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at Great Price
Reviews.Author: Spike Spiegel
Reviews.Content: Pros  1. very light weight, small but easy to handle, menu easy to manage/navigate  2. improved quality pic taking.  auto adjust to different environment/lighting, auto adjust to shaky hand. wide screen option is provided.  3. good looking design, multicolor, i got a green color cam to join Obama's "Green xyz" rah rah.  4. good pricing. $149.  cheaper than my AS Powershot  Cons  1. battery. need to walk around with a battery charger.  inconvenient.  nice if rechargeable from PC's USB port.  2. memory. camera comes without memory card, fortunately, i can swap the card from my other PowerShot cam.  3. cam pouch.  nice if a small cloth pouch is provided.overall, great price for a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Very decent for a Point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Y. Ioselzon
Reviews.Content: Second Canon I own.First one also was digital Elf that was broken. (no fault of camera)Got upgrade. Works well for something you can carry on a mountain bike or skiing slope.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1200IS
Reviews.Author: Geo-Be
Reviews.Content: The screen is large, which is great. Older folks appreciate that.  It is easy to use and has so many unbelievable features!  It can be either movie camera or still camera.  The features are too many to enumerate but I would strongly recommend this camera to anyone.  It was rated as top pick on Consumer Reports and that is why I bought it.  A 4 gigabyte card (which is cheap) gets you over 6000 pictures.

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Herridge
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to use and seems to give good pictures.Have had no problem with initial use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but could use some technical and design tweeking
Reviews.Author: The Vintage Gal
Reviews.Content: We upgraded from the SD1000 model, which we loved. The size of the SD1200 is bigger than SD1000 and a bit clunkier, but it is still compact enough for your pocket. On/off button is more difficult to press, as it is not indented like the SD1000. That has caused the loss of taking quick, spontaneous photos a few times. The SD1200 has a selector button for going quickly from manual to automatic settings, which is an improvement. The ISO 1600 manual setting on the SD1200 is much better than the one on the SD1000--perhaps because of the added feature of "image stabilization", along with the improvement of pulling ambient light in dark situations. I would have to sit the camera on a very steady surface before, in order to get nice, ISO1600 photos. The SD1200 blows the SD1000 away in this area. ISO1600 photos now appear to almost be shot in daylight. Very nice. One very bad engineering feature is the auto "scene detection". Often, the SD1200 will auto choose micro, people or other. Often, it's selection is incorrect and the photo will come out blurry. Overall, this is a great camera for our needs.

Reviews.Title: Easy, crisp and colorful photos
Reviews.Author: Joanne C. "Dog Lover"
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon A540 that I liked, except for the AA batteries. They never seemed to last more than about 60 shots, regardless if they were rechargeable or not. For that reason, when my camera broke, I looked at other brands and bought a Sony W290. After a week, I returned it because the photos were fuzzy under lowlight conditions or when pets moved. I was really disappointed and so I exchanged it for this Canon, with a rechargeable battery (which I hope works much better than the AA batteries!) Right away, I saw that the photos I took with the Canon were crisp, colorful, even with movement. I was very pleased with the quality compared to the Sony.My only gripe and it's not that much of one - I wish that the camera was just a little larger. I feel like I'm holding a small deck of cards by the edges and I wish I had a better hold on the camera when taking photos.  It has a wrist strap, but I feel like if someone bumped me in a crowd, that I would drop it. The old Canon I had wouldn't fit in a pocket, though, so I guess that is the good point about being so small.For the price, this is a great point and shoot camera!

Reviews.Title: so cute!
Reviews.Author: Missy G
Reviews.Content: this camera is the absolute cutest! this is technically my first digital camera i've had and i immediately fell in love with it. great quality photos and easy to use. get a case though.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: P. Whalen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take to Italy with me on a study abroad trip.  So far it's been an amazing camera and I'm so glad I picked it!

Reviews.Title: camera feedback
Reviews.Author: Ernie D. Smith "technofumble"
Reviews.Content: I am by far no photographer. I like this thing, it is small, will fit just about anywhere. I have medium large hands but have no problems with making this camera perform the tasks that I want it to. Really like the rechargeable battery. The memory card is really nice also. Didn't have any problems downloading pictures into computer or printer. Have yet to find any faults with this camera, so far.

Reviews.Title: amazing upgrade.
Reviews.Author: M. disalvatore
Reviews.Content: I had the olympus fe-230 for 2 years and went through 2 of them. Olympus has not made a decent camera that I have seen. I purchased this as an upgrade and it sure kicks a**. It took a while to figure out how to get to all the other settings, but it has'nt let me down yet. I just wish the strap it came with was adjustable so i wouldnt have to worry about it slipping off my wrist. but than can be changed.amazing camera overall. no cons yet.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: M. Robnett
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived on time and in great condition -- as advertised. Have had no issues with its operation and the pictures are great!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: G. Veal
Reviews.Content: Great little camera - everything you could hope for in a purse or pocket sized camera.

Reviews.Title: SD1200IS
Reviews.Author: Barin Beard
Reviews.Content: I am somewhat disappointed with the SD1200IS. Though it take great photos under the right conditions, it does not have the great manual features my SD1000 had, which this camera replaced (after the unfortunate destruction of my SD1000). I guess that is my biggest gripe. Its a pretty good point-and-shoot, and I like the size, and I am somewhat a Canon camera loyalist now (This is my 5th Powershot in 10 years...S100, S240, A340, SD1000, SD1200IS), but I would like to see the same manual options of the SD1000. Some new features, like the photo review button are handy, as is the exposure button. I went ahead and bought the underwater housing for this camera since the lack of one is what killed my SD1000. I hope to get to use it more while scuba diving and other water sports. Overall, this is a good camera, but more manual options would make it better.

Reviews.Title: Former SLR man is converted
Reviews.Author: Norman D. St Clair
Reviews.Content: Smaller than a pack of "cancer sticks," I carry this little gem in my front pants pocket so I am always ready to capture the moment. Transferring the images to my computer is snap. I love it!

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Irie Rose
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera! I'm 100% satisfied with it. I've shot 3 weddings since I purchased it and the results were better than what I got with my professional Nikon. The brides agreed. The color doesn't hurt either! I love my green canon!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Clower
Reviews.Content: I have purchased Canon cameras in the past and once again I am very satisfied with my purchase. The camera is easy to use and takes excellence pictures.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD1200IS
Reviews.Author: MouVil "A-MouVil"
Reviews.Content: the size and design is super!  for the price it's great except it only have limited features.

Reviews.Title: Overall good purchase
Reviews.Author: J. Drott
Reviews.Content: I previously owned another Canon and was totally happy with it.  I am very happy with the SD1200IS so far.  It seems to have a little more trouble focusing quickly but I think that has more to do with my lack of abilty and understanding than the camera.  It is more sophisticated than my last Canon and has more features which I need to read the manual on to learn to use better.  I would definitely recommend this camera and the Canon brand in general.

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: 4hulagirls
Reviews.Content: I'm not a camera expert and I can't tell you all the high tech stuff about the camera, but I do know it takes great pictures. After getting the camera, i walked around taking pictures of everyday things - phone, basketball, tree etc. just to see if I was going to keep the camera.
