Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: JPB
Reviews.Content: The automatic mode is really bad, it keeps switching to the macro mode for some reason even if I don't want to take a close picture and 1 picture out of 2 is blurry / useless.Video mode is fine.

Reviews.Title: sd1200i
Reviews.Author: T. Flores "Zambooy"
Reviews.Content: Net Net I was totally disappointed with this camera. I was expecting incredible looking photos every time I pushed the button. At least half the pictures came out bad. The pictures were either blurry or dark. I have seen better cheep cell phone pictures. And the instruction booklet is a joke. Good luck on trying to resize your photos. The booklet was not written for consumers. This is just another classic case of paying for a name and receiving an inferior product.

Reviews.Title: Seller Great, Camera Useless
Reviews.Author: Friends Fab Fan
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived quickly and in good shape. I downloaded the software with ease. I programmed the camera to shoot items in my photo tent and hooked it up to my tripod. The pictures were horrid. I re-programmed it every which way and could never get a decent shot. Maybe only good for amateur sight-seeing photos.

Reviews.Title: SD 1200IS NOT LATER MODEL OF SD550
Reviews.Author: HOOK
Reviews.Content: THE CANNON SD 1200IS IS ADVERISED AS A NEWER MODEL OF THE VENERABLE SD550. THE SD 1200IS HAS INCREASED PIXEL COUNT AND WILL ADDRESS 8 GIG OF MEMORY INSTEAD OF 2 GIG (SD550). THERE ARE SOME OTHER MINOR CHANGES, BUT THE BIG UNSTATED DIFFERENCE IS THAT THIS IS NOT A NEWER MODEL OF THE SD550. THE CASE DIMENSIONS ARE DIFFERENT (THUS THE UNDERWATER CASE WILL NOT CROSS FIT) THE BATTERY ALTHOUGH SAME VOLTAGE AND MAKE IS SLIGHLTY DIFFERENT IN PROFILE AND THE BATTERIES ARE NOT INTERCHANGEABLE. ALL IN ALL IT IS A GOOD CAMERA, BUT SHOULD NOT BE ADVERTISED AS A NEWER MODEL OF THE SD550 AS IT IS A TOTALLY DIFFERENT CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: How can people say it has problems and yet give it 5 stars?
Reviews.Author: Alas, 'tis I!
Reviews.Content: This review goes out to all of you crack smokers who say it has issues yet still give it 5 stars!  What are you thinking, exactly?  Why does "not perfect" rate a "perfect" rating?It's small.  The metal body is nice and feels sturdy.  The plastic door for the battery/card is absolutely pathetic - feels like the cheap cheese it is.  It wouldn't be so bad, I suppose, if it weren't:- right on the corner (it's going to take a hit and break)- right where you hold the camera (it just feels so cheap and gross!)And, of course, it takes crap pictures.  I want a point and shoot that takes decent pictures.  What, exactly, is wrong with that, anyway?  What, exactly, is so hard about that, anyway?  I want to take it out of my pocket on auto mode and be able to take a good shot - from the hip, in under a second.  I have children - things happen very quickly.  Pictures come out fuzzy, over exposed, under exposed, with terrible colors, with vertical light streaks, completely out of focus (the auto focus is incredibly lame and slow - it does a complete out and in on the lens every shot.  Who designed this thing, anyway?).  Pathetic.  Then there's the lens assembly.  Golly, it looks EXACTLY like the one that failed on my other PowerShot (which also took crap pictures).  I'm not happy with Canon, that's for sure!On the plus side, the LCD is good enough on this one that you can see/tell that your pictures are crap (as opposed to the SD770IS where the pictures look good on the little screen so you only take one or two.  Then...  When you download them...  Boy, aren't you ever bummed that they're just GARBAGE).Glad I bought myself the equivalent of a micro 4/3 - I get awesome pictures every shot and it's pretty close to pocket-sized.  This...  This isn't any better than a throwaway 35mm camera.  Take a ton of pictures!  Maybe that way you can get one that's decent enough to print (small format, of course, 'cause there's no way it will ever take anything decent).

Reviews.Title: Skip this one and get the SD1300 or SD1400...
Reviews.Author: PeppermintPatti "Gina"
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the SD1100 with 8 MP, but thought I could get even better 8x10's and larger prints with more mega pixels. So I bought the SD1200 with 10 MP's and was not really impressed. The SD1100 is a better camera. I think that my main complaint is that the flash never worked and since most of my work involved daytime hours, I didn't notice this until the warranty ran out. Now I just use it for everyday shots and short video. I will admit that it is very sturdy-it took a fall on concrete and sustained only minor scratching. I've never dropped a camera before so I don't know how this would compare to others but I suspect that it fared well. I intend to upgrade to either the newer SD1400 or whatever comes next. Canon quality is awesome. Don't want to penalize Canon-I believe that I just got a lemon this time. My advice would be to research the newer versions of this camera. It should be mentioned that Amazon's usually impressive packing was lacking in this instant and may have contributed to the faulty flash.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what it's used for
Reviews.Author: Caylin A. Boswell
Reviews.Content: I originally had the same model camera, or so I thought.  When I purchased this one as a replacement for the one I lost it came in different packaging as well as had different sounds that accompanied the actions.  The pictures it takes are still fabulous and I'm still very happy with the camera itself, just felt like I did not get the same model as my original.

Reviews.Title: Great Point & Shoot with Issues
Reviews.Author: L. Monte
Reviews.Content: I bought this when my Sony Cybershot died. After weeks of researching, I decided on this camera. It seemed you can't beat it for the price. I'm an amateur photographer and my main camera is a Canon Rebel Xti DSLR. I wanted a camera to put in my pocket when I don't feel like lugging around my DSLR. Here's the good and the bad of this camera, I've had for a few months now...Pros:-Great, amazing, crisp Macro shots! This camera rivals my DSLR for Macro quality, beads of water on plants, flowers, food, etc. anything close up and this camera shines.-Outdoors this camera takes great landscape photos. Even at night, given you use a tripod this camera has great infinity detail.-Compact and slim enough to fit in jeans pocket.-Battery life, as with all Canons, is amazing. I'll use it for almost a week straight without needing a charge.-LCD is great, very vibrant, too vibrant I think, pics aren't as contrasted as it makes them look, but great nonetheless.Cons:-Flash is really harsh! So bad to where it's almost unusable indoors at night. My last camera had an option to adjust the flast either + or - one setting to adjust it's strenghth and I almost always left in on the minus (-) setting. If this camera had that, I'd give it 4 stars. It's so harsh that I'm considering a Gary Fong diffuser for it and permanently attaching it to it. It just blows out subjects, especially in Macro, forget about it.-Zoom is glitchy. The zoom constantly isn't smooth. It'll catch as I zoom in or out periodically and stall as I hold down the zoom switch.-It's very slippery. This camera has a very smooth finish and makes it easy to slip out of your hands. There's nothing to grip ontom it's all one smooth surface.Conclusion: This is a great camera for outdoors and macro shots, but indoors suffers, as most point and shoot cameras do, with a harsh flash. I'd look for a camera with an adjustable flash level because all digital camera's flashes by default are too bright and harsh for indoors. For $150 though, you can't ask for too much from this little camera...

Reviews.Title: camera not so great
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Nelson
Reviews.Content: I wasn't very impressed with this camera. It is extremely slow to take the picture and the pictures can be a little grainy. Also there is an awful lot of red-eye that needs to be fixed.

Reviews.Title: No memory card included!!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Hauber
Reviews.Content: Well, I should have read every last detail and I did not.  That's right....no memory card included...much to my surprise.  This a birthday gift for tomorrow and now I have another errand!!!  BUY A MEMORY CARD WITH THIS CAMERA!!!  Could they just charge more and INCLUDE everything I need, you know??!!!!

Reviews.Title: Another Disappointing Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: This is my second attempt to give a Canon digital camera a try~once again~a disappointment.  The indoor picture quality is lousy.  Auto mode is apparentlyuseless. The pic's come out grainy and dark if you are taking a pic with limited light indoors & some were even dark just in one part of the pic.  The color of things in some of the pic's was COMPLETELY off.  For example, a wall or tablecloth that is white or creme was YELLOW / GREEN.  I previously purchased a Canon Powershot A1100IS and THAT camera ALSO took poor indoor pictures.  If you are looking for a point & shoot that takes great pic's, I would keep looking.  I am done with Canon and will try another brand.

Reviews.Title: question about date and time imprint
Reviews.Author: G. C. Belen
Reviews.Content: hi, i am looking to buy a new point and shoot and i'm leaning to buy canon sd1200. the reviews i'm reading are good so far.  i just have one question, does this sd1200 has a date and time imprint on the photos?

Reviews.Title: Fun Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Rufina
Reviews.Content: This camera is a fun little camera.  I learned to use this camera quickly and have enjoyed it since day one.  The picture quality is great for a reasonably priced camera.  The only item I would improve at this point would be a quicker focus, so the camera would take some shots faster.  Other than that I would definitely buy this camera again!

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Brent Corder
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great buy. It exceeded expectation for what I paid for it. Easy to use and it takes great pictures. The only negative I have to say about this purchase is I didnt realize it didnt come with a sd card and it was a christmas present. Was hoping to use it on Christmas Day. But that was my fault for not reading everything.

Reviews.Title: Little noisy in auto mode
Reviews.Author: M. Cornelius
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, very compact and full of features. I was a little disappointed when I placed the auto focus on full auto due to continuous lens noise adjustment. But great camera.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: J. Ream "getalonglittledoggie"
Reviews.Content: Works very well, a little simpler than my SD800IS.  Since it was given as a gift not having a SD card in the box was a bummer.

Reviews.Title: Handle with Extreme Caution
Reviews.Author: M. Gibboney
Reviews.Content: There is something wrong with these cameras. Reading all the great reviews makes me think something changed during manufacturing. I've gone through two of these cameras now because with the slightest impact the sensor goes out. It will turn on after that but there's just a blank screen. The second one I had for all of two days and had taken one picture before the sensor went out. The last Canon Powershot I had lasted five years and still going without a single problem! Hopefully I can find one that doesn't have this issue.

Reviews.Title: Canon Review
Reviews.Author: Carissa
Reviews.Content: Great product and the picture quality is outstanding.  Just wish it had the same feature they had in the last model

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: C. D. Blodgett "Dave Blodgett"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased two other Canon Digital cameras. Both came with a minimum memory chip. Not SD1200IS.The Amazon ad did not tell me the camera does not come with a memory chip. When I complained to the seller, they simply replied by listing the featurs of the product and failed to respond to my complaint. Fortunately I had a 2 GB chip to use.I have seen ads for this camera at lower prices.

Reviews.Title: Fits My Needs
Reviews.Author: Raquel Thomas
Reviews.Content: The camera does everything I need it to do. The picture quality is excellent, camera is easy to use. The only thing that annoyed me was that is didn't come with the memory card. It's only an extra $11.00 at the local electronics store but still..Otherwise, I'm enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: Good 1st Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Silva "Love them Bruins"
Reviews.Content: This is our first digital camera.  We bought it on the basis of the strong review of the product in Consumer Reports.  Overall we love the portability and convenience of it, it was easy to learn to use.  We're not impressed with the quality of images produced, but we've only looked at them on the built in lcd screen, so we don't know how they'd look on a bigger screen or printed out.  It was easy to learn how to use from the directions, easy to download the software onto our family home computer.  The only problem: we didn't know we'd also have to purchase a memory card for the camera, so that was a little bit of an inconvenience.  Tip: it would have been easier if we'd just purchased the memory card Amazon said many other buyers purchased along with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Would consider others
Reviews.Author: luvwireless "Kris"
Reviews.Content: The size of this camera is excellent.  I love the color.  However, it doesn't seem to be well built and solid.  However, time will tell on that score.  I haven't had it long enough to know about the battery life.  Seems to take good photos and holds a lot of them.  Easy to transfer to my computer.  I would probably buy another if I were looking at this price range.  If I could spend more, I would probably buy a different one.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD1200IS
Reviews.Author: G. Radocaj
Reviews.Content: This camera is extremely light and portable, perfect for throwing in the purse or pocket.  Great megapixel size, good quality pictures.  Only thing I've found so far that I miss is a zoom function.  I had chosen to forgo this feature for the smallness of the camera, but think I made a mistake.  I'm very used to my Canon Rebel and having many zoom lenses, but thought it wouldnt bother me to not have zoom.  Wrong!  However, having said that, overall I love this little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: phOtOcat "S"
Reviews.Content: I needed a small digital camera for my wife to carry around. I didn't want to spend too much. Also I wanted to have it converted to infrared. This camera was exacted what I needed. It is small, responsive, sensitive in very low light situations,cost only $129 to have it converted to "infrared only". The pictures are great! I carry it with me more than the much heavier in weight and price Canon G-10, also converted to infrared.Can't comment on its use as an unconverted camera, but from what I can see, it would have been a good one.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera with bad nigh shooting
Reviews.Author: Alparslan Atakan Yildiz
Reviews.Content: I like the camera. In the day light you can take nice photos. But I didnt like night shooting without flash. May be i couldnt manage but if its so it should be easier to configure. It has good battery. So small and 10 mps is satisfiying.

Reviews.Title: canon sd1200
Reviews.Author: A. Saxena
Reviews.Content: Happy with the product.1. Looks: good, very small and compact, easy to use2. photos are good even though not used all features yet3. the only irritating thing is the auto focus; if it is on then it will continue to make focus adjusting noises.3. Amazon took long time to ship. ordered on 3-May, received around 12-May.

Reviews.Title: nice design, too bad it takes lousy pictures
Reviews.Author: lindsay
Reviews.Content: Nice design, too bad it takes lousy pictures. My 2 year old Canon point & shoot died one week into a 6 week trip to Mexico, so I paid way too much for this camera in a small town. Then after 2 weeks the LCD display stopped functioning on playback mode. The camera was never dropped or mistreated. A local camera shop checked that the photos were in fact being recorded, and said that they saw more problems with Canon's "consumer grade" cameras than with other makers. Worse, the colors looked way off in the LCD during the brief time that the playback functioned. I hoped that this was only on the camera. Unfortunately when I got home and got my pictures up on the computer the color rendition was terrible, and this for basic automatic outdoor shots. Warranties for a camera sold in Mexico are not valid in the US. Also, the performance in low light was quite poor. At least the design is pleasing.

Reviews.Title: fits in the pocket and shoots great photos and video
Reviews.Author: Marcus Jose
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD1200IS 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD fits in the pocket and shoots great photos and video.

Reviews.Title: Bargain?
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Brown
Reviews.Content: Nice price for a camera with great pictures, size of camera great, however the price turned out to be the same as local stores, best buy, target, walmart, even local office equipment stores, and i got my shipment in three seperate del. the sim card was backed ordered so i cancelled and went to walmart an purchased it cheeper...so back to the old story BUYER BE WARE...

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1200IS 10 MP Digital Camera, Orange
Reviews.Author: Aronda Stovall
Reviews.Content: I love my camera!!!  I love the color (but lime green would have been my first choice)!!!!  This camera is very light weight.  It does a lot that I am still finding out while learning to use all of the functions of the camera.  I think this is a great camera that is not too expensive but still some of the flair of the upper end cameras....

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: C. Jaeger
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at Wal-Mart (the screen seemed fuzzy.)  So I went to Best Buy and purchased one there (the screen was still a liitle fuzzy.) I compared the screen to my old canon (about 3 years old.)  That screen was a little fuzzy too, but the pictures are great. This is a great camera, light weight, easy to use.  I love it.  I got the blue color and it looks so sharp.  I highly recommend it. I went to a concert recently and It look OUTSTANDING pictures.

Reviews.Title: Not too sure...
Reviews.Author: K. Bryant
Reviews.Content: It's very cute, but really small.  Almost too small to operate. The automatic mode is really no good.  I took a bunch of pictures at my birthday party and most of them were grainy or blurry.  Outdoor pictures during the day turned out really well.  Also the lens is a pretty narrow angle, it's like you want to zoom OUT, but that's not an option.  Compared with other digital cameras it takes good pictures, but it's a little complicated to use.  Stay away from auto mode and take some time to understand your camera before you shoot, and you'll be fine.  If you don't mind the size.  I've had mine for about 3 weeks and have debated whether I want to return it and try something different, still not sure.

Reviews.Title: canon Power Shot  sd1200is 10x
Reviews.Author: Robert Peters
Reviews.Content: a superior camera with excellent clarity even allows motion picturesonly drawback is a i second delay in taking picture

Reviews.Title: Garbage, Don't Buy!
Reviews.Author: Sean P Conlon
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on highly favorable reviews in Consumer Reports and throughout the Internet, and my experience owning a Canon S230 camera which took excellent photos in everything but dim lighting. I can't believe they are talking about the same camera I now own. The image quality is consistently bad in almost all lighting conditions, and horrendous in low light conditions. It can take good pictures indoors in macro mode with the flash, depending on what the subject is.Images are consistently under or over-exposed, and even both in the same image. I returned my first camera thinking it was defective, and got a replacement from another retailer. However the poor quality of the images and the test results I got from both were consistent between both cameras.When taking landscape pictures outdoors in perfect lighting of trees with clouds in the background, the trees will usually come out as underexposed, blackish blobs even if they are not in shadow, while clouds will usually be just formless, blown out white blobs. Forget about taking pictures in snow, which comes out as a formless white mass with little texture. Rusty tin roofs on barns = blown out white masses in most shots. I have taken hundreds of pictures and 90 percent of them are horrible, the rest mediocre. Only 1 percent could be rated as good but again, it depends on subject matter. Mind you my standard of comparison is my old 3mp Canon S230, Canon's el cheapo camera of yore, and with which I took over 15,000 excellent photos without playing with the controls.Despite the 10 megapixels, zooming on on images in an image viewing program beyond the default pixel depth reveals fuzzy and grainy images. Oddly, I can zoom in further with my 3mp S230 images before I see image degradation than I can with this thing.Problems seem to crop up any time you have dark and light subjects in the same frame. The camera will darken the darks and lighten the lights, while taking pictures of the same objects separately may yield good results.I wish I had good advice as to which camera to buy, but definitely avoid this camera like the plague. Unfortunately my experience with this camera has proven to me that you can't trust camera reviews, as most people just don't seem to have a critical eye for this sort of thing.

Reviews.Title: Fine if you only want half your pictures to turn out.
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera for Christmas after our 7 year old digital camera started giving me problems.  I know he researched it, and I really wanted to love this camera.Here's what's great about it:* It's really small and light to carry around* The battery life is amazing!  I love that it can recharge, and lasts forever.  (my old one chewed through aa batteries like nobody's business)* It holds a ton of picturesI'm giving it 2 stars because:* Picture quality is terrible!  Seriously, my husband gets better pictures from his camera phone.* You can't use the zoom feature at all or the picture will turn out blurry.  You may as well not bother to take the picture.* If you're inside, the flash is going to go off.  It doesn't matter if you're in a very bright spot, the flash will go, and make the picture washed out.* You have to hold the shutter halfway down for the camera to focus, and THEN take the picture.  So much for quick candid shots.Like I said before, I really wanted to love this camera.  I'm not a photographer, and needed something small and easy to use, so I could take quick pictures of my family while we were having fun.  This camera makes my (not so great) photography abilities look even worse.

Reviews.Title: Nice Cam
Reviews.Author: Mrinal Kochar
Reviews.Content: It is a pretty good point n shoot cam for the price. I wanted a cam which would fit in my pocket and do a good job. Perfect for that.

Reviews.Title: No memory card
Reviews.Author: James Mcdowell
Reviews.Content: Just received the Canon Power Shot SD1200 last night from Amazon. Opened camera to get battery to charge and noticed no memory card. Called Canon Customer Service to tell them card was missing and was told camera does not come with a card. "Can I use it without a card." Answer: "No". Don't see anything in Amazon listing that suggests purchasing a memory card was mandatory for camera to function. At time of purchase there was an offer to purchase what, I thought, was an additional card for an additional price. Don't see that posting today (3/02/2010.

Reviews.Title: I hate this camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Harder "acharder"
Reviews.Content: I used to have another digital camera from canon ( a little more expensive) and I loved it, but when I broke it, I decided to go with this one because it was a little less expensive. The picture quality is very poor. The images are often blurry, and seem to be of low resolution (even though they aren't). I will send it back.

Reviews.Title: Poor packaging
Reviews.Author: Pong
Reviews.Content: The packaging box is too big and there is no sufficient air bag or sponge related protection material to protect the digital camera. Seller should consider to provide a better anti-shock packaging for digital devices.

Reviews.Title: Returned_ not used
Reviews.Author: Poppa Dog
Reviews.Content: Camera ordered as gift. Service and delivery were excellent. Returned as receipient decided they would rather have a Sony Cybershot.

Reviews.Title: Unworkable as sold
Reviews.Author: Reacass
Reviews.Content: I find it very unacceptable to pay $150 for a camera and find out that it cannot be used as sold.  It does not come with a memory card and nothing in the sales information provided prior to the purchase calls this out.  Therefore I will not buy another product from either the supplier or Canon.

Reviews.Title: Decent SD1200IS
Reviews.Author: Patrick Nguyen "Trance Music"
Reviews.Content: Pros:-DIGIC 4 Image Processor with Canon Face Detection Technology is much faster than DIGIC 3(from SD 790 IS)-Excellent camera for outdoor-Easy to use-Simple controls/menu-Nice features/settings-Bright LCD-Self-timer lets you get in your own pictures, you can take up to 3 times-Excellent image quality-Lightweight/Portable-Good battery life(Compact and lightweight battery charger with worldwide 100 ~220v compatability)Cons:-Made in China:(-2.5 LCD display-Poor Low-Light Performance-Somewhat Pricey(more than $200USD)I personally think it's a great camera for a basic traveler/camera buff who wants just a little more than a basic point and shoot.  I have this camera for couple months now, take about 21,000 pictures, will update more review on this camera.Update: I return this camera and got the Sony W230, which I think the color is better.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money but not stylish
Reviews.Author: Chess Worm "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the look of the camera, I thought I had ordered the model which was dark grey but was sent the silver model - the camera itself is good value I suppose, included was a 4gig card from Kensignton and a discount if you used discover card.

Reviews.Title: I HATE IT
Reviews.Author: Blanca Smart
Reviews.Content: I have always bought SONY cameras because of the picture quality, but when I decided to upgrade everyone told me that canon was way better, and so I bought this camera. What a waste, i really hate it, I am going to ive this one to my kid and go back to sony!I really do not recomend it

Reviews.Title: FREAKING AWSOME DAWGG!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Hayat Alajaji
Reviews.Content: I WAUB DIS CAMERA (= DUDE! I BOUGHT A CAMERA FOR A CAMPING TRIP AND I BOUGHT THIS CAMERA FOR IT! ITT'S AWSOME! I DOWNLOADED THE PICTURES SO EASILY AND THEY CAME OUT PERFECTLY! AND I TOOK A BUNCH OF PICS (64)! I DEEPLY RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA BESAUSE ITT'S A FORDABLE (KINDA ) AND IS AWSOME !THE ONLY THING THAT IS NOT GOOD ABOUT THIS CAMERA IS THAT ITT'S NOT BETTER THAN MEE! THAT'S IT!  -I LIKKE BAMBI (=P.S. THE TRIP WAS GOOD TOO (= TEHEE (=

Reviews.Title: No printed manual is a real negative to buying the SD1200
Reviews.Author: Serious Work
Reviews.Content: I have the SD1100 and love it.  My daughter needed a new camera and I bought one for her ... but it was the SD1200 model.  She hates having to constantly refer to the CD manual instead of a printed paper manual like I have on the SD1100 especially when away without the damn CD.  Perhaps once she's experienced all the problems you have learning a new camera she'll be OK but right now without a paper manual she could flip through to find what she needs to know, it's a real negative to buying this model in my opinion.  She was just over the other night and asked to borrow my printed manual even though the camera is somewhat different (hope I get it back).

Reviews.Title: This camera will stop working in about 2 years
Reviews.Author: Huck
Reviews.Content: I have owned two Canon Sureshot cameras.  The only thing to be sure of is, it will stop working in about 2 or 3 years...and you won't be able to fix it for a price less than a new camera.  Other than that, I like the camera.  I won't buy another small Canon camera again. Even though I'm a pretty forgiving person.Cheers.

Reviews.Title: COMES WITHOUT A MEMORY CARD!
Reviews.Author: DFE
Reviews.Content: It'd be helpful if there were a WARNING to buy a memory card with the camera. This is my first experience with a digital camera that did not come with everything you needed to be "up and running" in the box. POOH on Canon.Instead of the FREQUENTLY BOUGHT WITH THIS ITEM... maybe it needs to say somewhere in the SPECS or PRODUCT REVIEW [ok, I admit we did not read it CAREFULLY before purchase] that a memory card is NOT INCLUDED ... as in, batteries not included.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Ann B. Smith
Reviews.Content: Just updating our present camera--very happy with both, handed down the oder one to our daughter.

Reviews.Title: very fragile
Reviews.Author: J. Yamauchi
Reviews.Content: so fragile... and didn't like they changed battery size from SD1100 model.But overall better quality.

Reviews.Title: Not easy for mom to use, buttons terrible.
Reviews.Author: Fox45
Reviews.Content: I expected the latest Canon powershot for around $200 to OFCOURSE AUTOmatically be awesome.  I will not give a long review.  About functionality and ease of use- if you enjoy pressing buttons only to have another function take over instead, buy this camera.  If you enjoy only being able to use your fingernails to select, a battery door that will surely snap off sooner than later, and pictures that are not as sharp as the previous models, then go ahead.  Ofcourse I have been able to take some good shots with the legendary Canon name, but I am very upset that someone bought this for my Mom.  She refuses to use it based on hours of frustration with buttons that were cheaply designed for profit, not the true enjoyment of the user.  The next powershot will probably be great, you just never know.

Reviews.Title: fake camera
Reviews.Author: Ning He "Ning He"
Reviews.Content: this newest cannon powershot was worst than the old camera i bought three years ago. i dont think a real cannon powershot would do such a poor job!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot S2IS.
Reviews.Author: L. Laviana "lynne"
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon Powershot S2IS.  the camera is less than 2 yrs old.  While taking a picture it shut itself down and the lens stayed open and an E18 error came on the screen.  After some reseach and googled 40,000 complaints for this design flaw. I now have a $500 paperweight.  Canon will fix it for $150 plus parts or offer to let you purchase a refurbished camera starting at $199.  A class action suit was filed against Canon.  I will never buy another Canon product. Im very unhappy.

Reviews.Title: Poor Build Quality
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera to replace my Panasonic FX150 on a 1 month trip to Europe.The quality of the photos from that camera never compared to my canon SD1100 that I had given to a family member in Ireland last summer.I have had numerous Canon cameras in the past (SD110, 10D, 20D, Pro1 and the SD1100) and was rarley disapointed.So I purchased the SD1200 a few weeks before my trip and tested it at a tall ships event in Boston.As always the quality was perfect for holiday snaps right out of the camera.So I traveled to Ireland with the SD1200 and brought the Panasonic just in case we had an issue.We were traveling to Ireland, Venice, Munich and Salzburg so I wanted to make sure I had a back up camera.The first day in Ireland we went to Spanish Point.  It was a very windy day and as I was taking photos the camera shut down.I attempted to turn it back on, but kept getting a lens alignment error.After 83 photos the camera was dead because a strong wind knocked the lens out of alignment.I contacted cannon and they were of no help at all.  All I could get were the standard canned responses from support.No one actually addressed my dissatisfaction or offered a solution.  (Canon is in Europe also)So I went on my trip with the Panasonic FX150.  Got my pictures back today and as my wife noted they are not very good.  The FX150 randomly takes a nice photo, but most of the time they are overexposed or out of focus.  Yes you can blame the photographer, but no matter what you do with the FX150 it has a mind of its own and you don't buy a point and shoot camera to be messing around with manual settings on vacation photos.The bottom line is I would not recommend this camera due to its build quality.  Get the SD1100 (I think they were built in Japan - at least the early models) but avoid the camera in my opinion.  And if you do buy it keep your old one as a backup, bad pictures are better than no pictures.

Reviews.Title: My camera is so easy to use and I have opporunity to see what thier software is and it is so awesome!
Reviews.Author: Michelle Trzecinski "jackson"
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD1200IS 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Dark Gray)

Reviews.Title: Without a memory card
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Barberena
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my daugther and she seems to be enjoying it.  It was on sale at Staples for about 10 dollars more.  I decided to buy at Amazon and was surpised when the camera showed up minus the memory card.I guess i should have called and asked, but it is my sixth digital camera and the first one to arrive without a card.  I bought the card from Amazon for another 10 dollars.Next time I need to be more careful.The camera is beautiful and works well.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera i ever bought
Reviews.Author: S. reddy
Reviews.Content: this is the worst camera i ever bought,one buys camera for picture quality, and it lacks the same, my earlier 3.1pixel nikon camera is better than this.all the images are blurred for no reason.

Reviews.Title: two oddities
Reviews.Author: East Village
Reviews.Content: just bought today -- too early to evaluate photos but wanted to alert potential buyers that the CD which has the users manual and all the computer software DOES NOT WORK for Windows 2000, nor does Canon offer any substitute online.also, a review I read had mentioned incesssant auto-focusing.  It true and somewhat disconcerting.  Not sure I am happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Works like a charm
Reviews.Author: Ramzan Magomedov
Reviews.Content: Item being reviewedCanon PowerShot SD1200IS 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Dark Gray)

Reviews.Title: Late shipment
Reviews.Author: M. Chiang "Christy F"
Reviews.Content: I don't have chance to test this product. It took longer time to ship this product than it supposed to be.

Reviews.Title: Camera OK, shipping SLOW
Reviews.Author: G. Harding
Reviews.Content: So far the camera has performed OK, although I have not had time to test it thoroughly.  The problem I had was the shipping time.  I selected standard shipping, which is listed as 3-5 business days.  That would have been plenty of time (with room to spare) for what I wanted, which was to use it for my son's birthday party and both kids' baptisms.  Unfortunately, it took almost 3 weeks to receive it!  Not sure what happened, but that was too late for both events; very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: doesn't work
Reviews.Author: gran-ma
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera as a gift. My daughter put it together at the birthday party. That's when we realized that there is no memory card in the package. We were unable to take any pictures! Very annoying!! and upsetting!!

ProductInfo.Features:
Compatible with SD/SDHC, MMC/MMC Plus/HC MMC Plus (not included)
Smart AUTO intelligently selects the proper settings
3x optical zoom and 2.5-inch PureColor LCD II screen
